comments:
Please assign to Marius.

I am running the Callisto RC2 build.

When attempting to perform statistical data collection from Linux (a variety of distributions have been tried), using a Sun JVM, the loaders fail to load any data into the models. I receive the following exception:

Thread[TCPDataFiller,6,main] - org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Document root element is missing.
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.fatal(Parser2.java:3376)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.fatal(Parser2.java:3364)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parseInternal(Parser2.java:668)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.parse(Parser2.java:337)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.XMLReaderImpl.parse(XMLReaderImpl.java:448)
	at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:345)
	at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:143)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.models.hierarchy.util.internal.CrimsonFragmentHandler.parse(CrimsonFragmentHandler.java:155)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.models.hierarchy.util.internal.CrimsonFragmentHandler$1.run(CrimsonFragmentHandler.java:83)

It seems that the data stream is missing the XML root element. I just fixed another problem in org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.piclient.XMLTraceDataProcessor that might be related with your problem, please run with the follwoing debug flags:

-vmargs -DModelDebugger.debugEventValue -vmargs -DCommunicationDebug.debugMessageValue

and check the / folder of the disk drive from where you eclipse.exe and attach the messageValue* and incommingData* files found there.

Try the lastest build which will use the new Xerces plugin to your plugin folder.

(In reply to comment #1)
> and check the / folder of the disk drive from where you eclipse.exe and attach
> the messageValue* and incommingData* files found there.
> 
> Try the lastest build which will use the new Xerces plugin to your plugin
> folder.
> 

Clarification: 
- from where you run eclipse.exe 
- the latest builds contains the new Xerces plugin which will be used instead of Crimson that comes with SUN JREs 1.4.
Targeted for 4.2 i4, please close it if the problem doesn't exist anymore, see my previous 2 comments.
Marked as P1 for further investigation and approval.
Please reopen and provide more info if you still have this problem.
